Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners










Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Show more

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

BitHive represents the connected world, offering innovative and customer-centric information technology experiences. The company focuses on leveraging next-generation technologies like 5G, blockchain, metaverse, quantum computing, cybersecurity, and artificial intelligence to enable end-to-end digital transformation for global customers. Connect with us at www.bithive-it.com.

Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a Data Analyst at BitHive. The Data Analyst will be responsible for tasks such as data analytics, data modeling, utilizing statistics, and effective communication in analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to provide valuable insights and recommendations for the organization.

Qualifications


Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Data Modeling
Ability to interpret and utilize statistical data effectively
Strong communication skills for presenting findings and collaborating with teams
Experience in data analysis tools and techniques
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or SQL
Minimum bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field

Company Description
BitHive represents the connected world, offering innovative and customer-centric information technology experiences. The company focuses on leveraging next-generation technologies like 5G, blockchain, metaverse, quantum computing, cybersecurity, and artificial intelligence to enable end-to-end digital transformation for global customers. Connect with us at www.bithive-it.com.

Role Description
This is a full-time remote role for a Data Analyst at BitHive. The Data Analyst will be responsible for tasks such as data analytics, data modeling, utilizing statistics, and effective communication in analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to provide valuable insights and recommendations for the organization.

Qualifications
  • Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Data Modeling
  • Ability to interpret and utilize statistical data effectively
  • Strong communication skills for presenting findings and collaborating with teams
  • Experience in data analysis tools and techniques
  • Proficiency in programming languages like Python, R, or SQL
  • Minimum bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

Description:
The Client

Our client is a digital hub company, founded by two of the largest companies in financial services and consultancy, with the goal of enabling innovation.

The result was a unique space where international corporates sit side-by-side and work together with cutting-edge startupsThe RoleFor one of their founding companies, they need a data analyst to be able to support on various fintech projects.

Data Analysis
Data visualisation

What they need

You are an experienced data analyst with 3+ years of experience
You have worked in banking or Fintech companies
You have experience with various data analyst tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Google analytics

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Python / SQL / Clean Energy / Hydrogen / Data Engineer




Interested in using your Data Analysis / Engineering background to help tackle some of the biggest challenges in the Clean Technology market?




You'll join a team that are a market leader in the production and storage of Green Hydrogen, who have recently started looking for a Senior Energy Data Analyst to join their team in Berlin (Hybrid / Remote available).




The role:




As a key member of the team's Data group you'll enjoy a lot of responsibility, and will take a lead role in designing the structure of the existing database, analyse weather and market price data, and act as the interface between the electricity market, RES generation, and in-house Hydrogen production teams.




What's on offer?




A very competitive compensation package.




The chance to enjoy a lot of responsibility as part of a small team of experts
A hands-on engineering role with one of the best funded Clean Technology teams in the industry




Ideally you'll have a combination of:




Python
SQL
Show more

As a key member of the team's Data group you'll enjoy a lot of responsibility, and will take a lead role in designing the structure of the existing database, analyse weather and market price data, and act as the interface between the electricity market, RES generation, and in-house Hydrogen production teams.

  • The chance to enjoy a lot of responsibility as part of a small team of experts
  • A hands-on engineering role with one of the best funded Clean Technology teams in the industry


Ideally you'll have a combination of:


  • Python
  • SQL

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben:

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n engagierte*n und versierte*n (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d),

um unser Data-Team zu verstärken. In dieser Position kümmerst du dich um die eigenständige Beschaffung und Analyse von Social Media Daten sowie die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von effektiven Analyseansätzen und Lösungsideen.

Du entwickelst gerne kreative Analyseansätze und Lösungsideen?

Du bist ein echter Data-Storyteller und hast Lust in einem jungen, dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten?

Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich noch heute!


Du wertest Leistungsdaten über alle relevanten Social-Media-Kanäle hinweg aus und identifizierst dabei wichtige Trends und Muster
Mit modernsten Analysetools deckst du Potenziale auf und optimierst unsere Strategien.
Du leitest aus den Daten relevante Erkenntnisse ab und präsentierst diese in klaren, überzeugenden Empfehlungen an unsere Teams und Kunden.
Du optimierst und automatisierst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse und Workflows, um Effizienz und Genauigkeit zu steigern.
Du bereitest Daten visuell auf und erstellst aussagekräftige Dashboards, die auch komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich darstellen.
Du unterstützt interdisziplinäre Projektteams mit deinem analytischen Know-how und trägst dazu bei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen
Du entwickelst kreative Analyseansätze und findest innovative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen
Du entwickelst und implementierst Datenstrategien zur Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen



Du bringst mit


Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit Fokus auf quantitativer Research in einer Agentur, Unternehmen oder Unternehmensberatung
Du sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Du bist kreativ und findest in Kollaboration innovative Lösungen für datenbezogene Herausforderungen
Du bringst Wissen über Datenanalyse, Data Mining, Methoden der Datenexploration und -modellierung sowie Datenvisualisierung mit
Du kennst dich mit diversen Analytics-Tools aus wie R, Python oder PowerBI
Um komplexe Daten verständlich zu präsentieren und fundierte Empfehlungen zu geben bringst du strake kommunikative und analytische Fähigkeiten ein
Du hast Lust auf ein dynamisches Themenfeld zwischen Data und Analytics
Kenntnisse in GenAI, Large Language Models (LLMs)
Das klingt spannend? Und zudem wohnst du auch in Berlin? Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung mit frühestem Eintrittstermin und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.



Unser Versprechen

⭐️ Dynamisches Umfeld:

Bei StoryMachine erwartet dich ein dynamisches Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien, in dem deine Ideen und dein Verantwortungsbewusstsein gefragt sind.

⭐️ Persönliche Entwicklung:

Du wirst von Anfang an herausfordernde und vielfältige Aufgaben erhalten, die dein Potenzial entfalten und deine persönliche Weiterentwicklung fördern. Zudem hast du die Möglichkeit, in deiner neuen Rolle eigenverantwortlich zu arbeiten und dich weiterzuentwickeln.

⭐️ Flexibilität:

Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, zwischen unserem Büro in Berlin Mitte und Home Office zu wählen.

⭐️ Feedback-Kultur:

Wir legen Wert auf regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche, bei denen wir nicht nur dir Feedback geben, sondern auch dein Feedback einfordern.

⭐️ Teamgeist:

Bei uns findest du ein herzliches, diverses und ambitioniertes Team, das gemeinsam Großes erreichen möchte. Ebenso organisieren wir regelmäßige Team-Events wie wöchentliche Teamlunches und verschiedene gemeinsame Aktivitäten.

⭐️ Work-Life-Balance:

Wir setzen uns für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance ein und unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Service von , der ganzheitlichen Plattform für mentale Gesundheit, an.
Show more
HTML:
Deine Aufgaben:

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n engagierte*n und versierte*n (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d),

um unser Data-Team zu verstärken. In dieser Position kümmerst du dich um die eigenständige Beschaffung und Analyse von Social Media Daten sowie die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von effektiven Analyseansätzen und Lösungsideen.

Du entwickelst gerne kreative Analyseansätze und Lösungsideen?

Du bist ein echter Data-Storyteller und hast Lust in einem jungen, dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten?

Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich noch heute!

  • Du wertest Leistungsdaten über alle relevanten Social-Media-Kanäle hinweg aus und identifizierst dabei wichtige Trends und Muster
  • Mit modernsten Analysetools deckst du Potenziale auf und optimierst unsere Strategien.
  • Du leitest aus den Daten relevante Erkenntnisse ab und präsentierst diese in klaren, überzeugenden Empfehlungen an unsere Teams und Kunden.
  • Du optimierst und automatisierst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse und Workflows, um Effizienz und Genauigkeit zu steigern.
  • Du bereitest Daten visuell auf und erstellst aussagekräftige Dashboards, die auch komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich darstellen.
  • Du unterstützt interdisziplinäre Projektteams mit deinem analytischen Know-how und trägst dazu bei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen
  • Du entwickelst kreative Analyseansätze und findest innovative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen
  • Du entwickelst und implementierst Datenstrategien zur Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen


Du bringst mit

  • Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit Fokus auf quantitativer Research in einer Agentur, Unternehmen oder Unternehmensberatung
  • Du sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
  • Du bist kreativ und findest in Kollaboration innovative Lösungen für datenbezogene Herausforderungen
  • Du bringst Wissen über Datenanalyse, Data Mining, Methoden der Datenexploration und -modellierung sowie Datenvisualisierung mit
  • Du kennst dich mit diversen Analytics-Tools aus wie R, Python oder PowerBI
  • Um komplexe Daten verständlich zu präsentieren und fundierte Empfehlungen zu geben bringst du strake kommunikative und analytische Fähigkeiten ein
  • Du hast Lust auf ein dynamisches Themenfeld zwischen Data und Analytics
  • Kenntnisse in GenAI, Large Language Models (LLMs)
  • Das klingt spannend? Und zudem wohnst du auch in Berlin? Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung mit frühestem Eintrittstermin und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

⭐️ Work-Life-Balance:

Wir setzen uns für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance ein und unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Service von , der ganzheitlichen Plattform für mentale Gesundheit, an.

Title: Data Analyst Lending - FinTech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world’s leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for a Data Analyst Lending to join the Fintech Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Our team creates innovative lending products across multiple markets, catering to the diverse needs of consumers, vendors, and riders on our platform. We design solutions that enhance our customers' experiences, ensuring that our lending portfolio provides value and support.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Work in a highly effective team responsible for the processing of financial transactions amounting to billions of euros
Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, set the roadmap for analytics work of various products offer lending solutions to our consumers, vendors, and riders
Collaborate with the Data Science team to optimize the performance of our lending portfolios
Explore and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns, and actively take actions to improve lending portfolio performance across multiple regions
Collaborate with the central teams in Berlin as well as with the regional and local teams to run A/B tests, and experiments, and drive best credit management practices across the globe
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech setup


What you need to be successful

Your heroic skills:


Relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence or comparable functions within organizations focused on credit
Proficiency with SQL
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and Looker) to build intuitive and insightful data stories.
Familiarity with mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques (such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to implement business strategy to data analysis and make recommendations to product and business stakeholders
Good and versatile communication and presentation skills (technical vs business vs layman vs C-level)


Nice to have:


Credit analytics experience, familiarity with BNPL and/or Credit Scoring
Experience with big data tools (e.g. BigQuery, Spark, dbt)
Proficiency with Python


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information
Show more

Über uns

StoryMachine ist eine 2017 gegründete Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt auf strategischem Storytelling für Brands, Persönlichkeiten und politische Institutionen. Die Basis unseres integrativen Storytellings ist journalistisch und komplett datengetrieben. Wir betrachten Social Channels nicht isoliert, sondern heben ihre Stärken und Besonderheiten hervor und bringen sie zum Vorteil unserer Kund*innen ein.

Unser Büro befindet sich in einem alten Varieté-Theater mitten im Herzen von Berlin. Dort triffst du auf einzigartige Charakterköpfe als Kolleg*innen und in regelmäßigen Networking-Events auf bekannte Personen aus der Politik-, Wirtschaft- und Medienwelt.

Klingt nice? Geht noch besser!

Bei StoryMachine schreibst du Geschichte(n) – und bekommst dafür den Freiraum, um dich kreativ zu entfalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Du bist als Mitarbeiter*in von StoryMachine von spannenden Kund*innen aus verschiedensten Branchen, vom Hidden Champion über DAX-Konzerne bis hin zu internationalen Top-Brands involviert.

  • Du wertest Leistungsdaten über alle relevanten Social-Media-Kanäle hinweg aus und identifizierst dabei wichtige Trends und Muster
  • Mit modernsten Analysetools deckst du Potenziale auf und optimierst unsere Strategien.
  • Du leitest aus den Daten relevante Erkenntnisse ab und präsentierst diese in klaren, überzeugenden Empfehlungen an unsere Teams und Kunden.
  • Du optimierst und automatisierst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse und Workflows, um Effizienz und Genauigkeit zu steigern.
  • Du bereitest Daten visuell auf und erstellst aussagekräftige Dashboards, die auch komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich darstellen.
  • Du unterstützt interdisziplinäre Projektteams mit deinem analytischen Know-how und trägst dazu bei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen
  • Du entwickelst kreative Analyseansätze und findest innovative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen
  • Du entwickelst und implementierst Datenstrategien zur Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen

Du bringst mit

  • Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit Fokus auf quantitativer Research in einer Agentur, Unternehmen oder Unternehmensberatung
  • Du sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
  • Du bist kreativ und findest in Kollaboration innovative Lösungen für datenbezogene Herausforderungen
  • Du bringst Wissen über Datenanalyse, Data Mining, Methoden der Datenexploration und -modellierung sowie Datenvisualisierung mit
  • Du kennst dich mit diversen Analytics-Tools aus wie R, Python oder PowerBI
  • Um komplexe Daten verständlich zu präsentieren und fundierte Empfehlungen zu geben bringst du strake kommunikative und analytische Fähigkeiten ein
  • Du hast Lust auf ein dynamisches Themenfeld zwischen Data und Analytics
  • Kenntnisse in GenAI, Large Language Models (LLMs)
  • Das klingt spannend? Und zudem wohnst du auch in Berlin? Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung mit frühestem Eintrittstermin und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Unser Versprechen

⭐️ Dynamisches Umfeld

Bei StoryMachine erwartet dich ein dynamisches Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien, in dem deine Ideen und dein Verantwortungsbewusstsein gefragt sind.

⭐️ Persönliche Entwicklung

Du wirst von Anfang an herausfordernde und vielfältige Aufgaben erhalten, die dein Potenzial entfalten und deine persönliche Weiterentwicklung fördern. Zudem hast du die Möglichkeit, in deiner neuen Rolle eigenverantwortlich zu arbeiten und dich weiterzuentwickeln.

⭐️ Flexibilität

Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, zwischen unserem Büro in Berlin Mitte und Home Office zu wählen.

⭐️ Feedback-Kultur

Wir legen Wert auf regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche, bei denen wir nicht nur dir Feedback geben, sondern auch dein Feedback einfordern.

⭐️ Teamgeist

Bei uns findest du ein herzliches, diverses und ambitioniertes Team, das gemeinsam Großes erreichen möchte. Ebenso organisieren wir regelmäßige Team-Events wie wöchentliche Teamlunches und verschiedene gemeinsame Aktivitäten.

⭐️ Work-Life-Balance

Wir setzen uns für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance ein und unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Service von , der ganzheitlichen Plattform für mentale Gesundheit, an.

Über uns

StoryMachine ist eine 2017 gegründete Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt auf strategischem Storytelling für Brands, Persönlichkeiten und politische Institutionen. Die Basis unseres integrativen Storytellings ist journalistisch und komplett datengetrieben. Wir betrachten Social Channels nicht isoliert, sondern heben ihre Stärken und Besonderheiten hervor und bringen sie zum Vorteil unserer Kund*innen ein.

Unser Büro befindet sich in einem alten Varieté-Theater mitten im Herzen von Berlin. Dort triffst du auf einzigartige Charakterköpfe als Kolleg*innen und in regelmäßigen Networking-Events auf bekannte Personen aus der Politik-, Wirtschaft- und Medienwelt.

Klingt nice? Geht noch besser!

Bei StoryMachine schreibst du Geschichte(n) – und bekommst dafür den Freiraum, um dich kreativ zu entfalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Du bist als Mitarbeiter*in von StoryMachine von spannenden Kund*innen aus verschiedensten Branchen, vom Hidden Champion über DAX-Konzerne bis hin zu internationalen Top-Brands involviert.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wen suchen wir?

Willkommen in der faszinierenden Welt der Daten bei PAPER & TEA!

Hier, wo die Kunst der Teezubereitung auf die Wissenschaft der Datenanalyse trifft, suchen wir nach einem Data Analyst (m/w/d), mit einem Verständnis, Zahlen zum Sprechen zu bringen. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Teams durchforstest du große Datenströme, entdeckst verborgene Muster und entfaltest wertvolle Erkenntnisse, die unsere Geschäftsentscheidungen beflügeln. Deine Expertise und dein Gespür für Trends helfen uns, die perfekte Balance zwischen Tradition und Innovation zu finden – und damit den Tee unserer Zukunft zu kreieren.

Deine Aufgaben

Als Data Analyst (m/w/d) bei PAPER & TEA spielst du eine Schlüsselrolle in unserer datengetriebenen Strategie. Deine Aufgaben umfassen:


Datenaufbereitung und Bereinigung: Du sammelst und bereitest Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen auf und stellst sicher, dass sie in höchster Qualität und Konsistenz vorliegen.
Datenanalyse und Interpretation: Mit deinem scharfen Blick für Details führst du statistische Analysen durch, identifizierst Muster und Trends und nutzt Data-Mining-Techniken, um wertvolle Einblicke zu gewinnen.
Datenvisualisierung: Du verwandelst komplexe Daten in ansprechende, visuelle Darstellungen und unterstützt die Kommunikation durch den Einsatz von Tools wie Tableau, Power BI oder Matplotlib.
Berichte und Dashboards: Du entwickelst regelmäßige Berichte und Dashboards zur Überwachung unserer KPIs und stellst relevante Metriken bereit, die unsere Geschäftsführung bei strategischen Entscheidungen unterstützen.
Datenmodellierung: Du entwickelst und pflegst Datenmodelle, die zur Strukturierung und Organisation unserer Daten beitragen und die Qualität der Datenanalyse verbessern.
Machine Learning und Predictive Analytics: Du implementierst Machine-Learning-Algorithmen und entwickelst prädiktive Modelle, um zukünftige Trends frühzeitig zu erkennen.
Datenbankverwaltung: Du sicherst die Integrität unserer Datenbanken durch Verwaltung, Pflege und Optimierung ihrer Performance und führst regelmäßig Backups und Wiederherstellungen durch.
Datenqualitätssicherung: Du implementierst Prozesse zur Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und führst regelmäßige Überprüfungen und Audits durch.
Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern: In enger Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Abteilungen erfüllst du deren Datenanforderungen und sorgst dafür, dass die Analyseergebnisse effektiv kommuniziert werden.
Weiterbildung und Schulung: Du bleibst immer auf dem neuesten Stand der Entwicklungen und Best Practices im Bereich Datenanalyse und nimmst an Schulungen und Konferenzen teil, um dein Wissen stetig zu erweitern.


In dieser Position bist du nicht nur Analyst, sondern ein kreativer Gestalter unserer datenbasierten Zukunft.

Dein Profil


Fundiertes Fachwissen: Dein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Bereich sowie deine umfassenden Kenntnisse in SQL und Datenbankverwaltung spiegeln unser Streben nach Präzision und Exzellenz wider.
Analytische Brillanz: Deine Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R und deine Fähigkeiten in Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau und Power BI machen dich zum Architekten der Erkenntnisse, die unsere Entscheidungen leiten.
Innovative Technologien: Deine Kenntnisse in Machine Learning und prädiktiver Modellierung sowie deine Erfahrung mit SAP Analytics unterstreichen deine Rolle als Wegbereiter für datengetriebene Innovationen in unserem Unternehmen.
Kommunikationsstärke: Deine Fähigkeit, komplexe Analyse Ergebnisse verständlich zu vermitteln, unterstützt unsere Philosophie der Transparenz und Zusammenarbeit.
Teamplayer-Mentalität: Du arbeitest gerne in multidisziplinären Teams, verfolgst gemeinsame Ziele und trägst dazu bei, unsere Werte von Herzlichkeit und Gemeinschaft zu leben.
Detailorientierung und Problemlösungsfähigkeit: Dein Auge fürs Detail und deine Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme durch logische, datenbasierte Lösungen zu meistern, sind zentral für unseren Erfolg.
Zeitmanagement und Flexibilität: Du planst und priorisierst effektiv, um Deadlines zu halten und passt dich flexibel an neue Anforderungen und dynamische Arbeitsumgebungen an.
Lernbereitschaft und kritisches Denken: Deine Offenheit für neue Methoden, Tools und Technologien sowie dein Drang, Annahmen zu hinterfragen und alternative Lösungswege zu evaluieren, treiben deine kontinuierliche persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung voran.
Projektmanagement-Skills: Deine Fähigkeit, Projekte zu planen, zu organisieren und erfolgreich abzuschließen, macht dich zu einem unverzichtbaren Partner in unserem Team.


Warum wir?

Ein Arbeitsumfeld auf Premium-Niveau: Genieße die Vorzüge eines exklusiven Arbeitsumfelds, das Professionalität mit der Leidenschaft für ausgezeichneten Tee und einem tiefen Bewusstsein für unsere gesellschaftliche Verantwortung verbindet.

Persönliche Entwicklung: Wir bieten dir zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterbildung, weil wir die Leistung jedes Einzelnen schätzen und wissen, dass unser gemeinsames Wachstum auf der stetigen Entwicklung jedes Teammitglieds beruht.

Ein Team von Helden: Bei uns findest du ein Team, das sich durch Zusammenhalt, Diversität und das gemeinsame Ziel auszeichnet, nicht nur die Welt sicherer zu machen, sondern auch einen positiven Beitrag zur Gesellschaft zu leisten.

Potenzielle Weiterentwicklung: Diese Position bietet die Möglichkeit zur Weiterentwicklung zum Team Lead Business Intelligence (BI). In dieser Rolle übernimmst du die Verantwortung für ein Team von BI-Spezialisten und gestaltest die BI-Strategie des Unternehmens maßgeblich mit. Du leitest die Implementierung und Optimierung von BI-Tools und -Systemen, um eine effektive Entscheidungsunterstützung zu gewährleisten. Zudem arbeitest du eng mit verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen, um deren BI-Anforderungen zu verstehen und umzusetzen. Durch die Übernahme von Führungsaufgaben und die Weiterentwicklung deiner Fähigkeiten im Bereich Business Intelligence und Teammanagement bereitest du dich auf diese verantwortungsvolle Position vor.

Über uns

Unsere Marke lässt sich nicht kategorisieren. Durch inspirierende und innovative Erlebnisse zeigen wir, was eine Marke in dieser Welt alles sein kann. Intern basiert unsere Unternehmenskultur auf Co-Kreation, individuellem proaktivem Handeln und kollektiver Unterstützung und Wertschätzung. Nach außen hin möchten wir Menschen und Orte mit Wärme und Freude verbinden. Wir möchten die Grenzen zwischen ihnen und uns aufweichen, unsere Gäste nicht als bloße Konsument:innen betrachten und ein Verständnis für ein gegenseitiges Miteinander fördern. Mit mehr als 35 Stores in aktuell sieben Ländern (Deutschland, Österreich, Schweiz, Niederlande, Belgien, Dänemark, Norwegen), einem internationalen Online-Shop und Team aus über 350 Mitarbeiter:innen tragen wir unsere Mission, das Leben zu bereichern, nach außen.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
At MBE Group we believe that a #PeoplePossible, diverse workforce drives our success. We base hiring decisions solely on candidate experience and skills.


For our offices in Berlin we are searching for a Business Intelligence Analyst. The E-commerce product manager will support the development and implementation of MBE Digital products and services proposition for the E-commerce target to ensure a seamless integration between business customers platforms and MBE logistics & shipping services provided by MBE Centers, to grow and widen MBE digital business solutions on the E-commerce community and drive profitability growth. Geographies of relevance are: Italy, Spain, Germany, France, Poland, Portugal, UK and Ireland.

 

Main Tasks and Responsibilities

 

  • To provide the business community data and reporting in order to monitor, manage, oversee and govern sales network;
  • To support Management in framework agreements’ negotiation building qualitative and quantitative analysis;
  • To support the corporate business functions and the franchisees by analyzing, managing and aligning business related financial data and KPI measurements;
  • To design reports/data extracts/dashboard related to new products/services/processes in order to verify business performances and profitability;
  • To contribute to operative processes improvement through data mining together with Information technology and Sales;
  • To support Network Sales & Operations to define profitable and competitive pricelists to attract and retain final customers.

 

 

Skills and Qualifications

 

  • Fluent in both German and English
  • Completed university-level degree with record of strong academic performance in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or similar fields preferred;
  • 3 years experience in BI roles;
  • Strong numerical, analytical and conceptual skills with a strategic mind set;
  • Structured approach, process oriented, attentive to details and able to prioritize;
  • Enthusiasm for technology and its application to new situations to enhance business efficiency;
  • Advanced user of MS Office Products (Excel), Google, SQL and other business productivity software;
  • Excellent mastery of written and spoken English;
  • Willingness to explore, learn and problem solve.

 

 

 

What We Offer:


●     A vibrant international environment in a continuously growing company.

●     Extensive training and development opportunities within the group, including an eLearning platform

●     A multicultural organizational structure and team.

●     Hybrid working policy (60/40)

●     Volunteer Day

●     Fitness and Transportation allowance

 

 


About MBE Worldwide

MBE Worldwide S.p.A., a privately-owned company headquartered in Italy, is a leading commerce enablement platform for SMBs and consumers providing e-commerce, fulfillment, shipping, marketing and print solutions via multi-brand, multi-channel operations: PrestaShop, Mail Boxes Etc. (except in the US and Canada), PostNet, PACK & SEND, Spedingo.com, AlphaGraphics, Multicopy, Print Speak, GEL Proximity and World Options. In 2023, the combination of its physical platform - that currently counts 3,190 Business Solutions Centers in 58 countries with more than 12,500 associates - with its digital e-commerce platform, served over 1.1 mln business customers worldwide generating €1.4 bln (US$1.5 bln) of System-wide Gross Revenue and €22 bln (US$23.8 bln) of Gross Merchandise Value.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst- 12 Months Fixed Term (f/m/d)
Description:
Why Scout24?

Scout24 is home of ImmoScout24, Germany's #1 for real estate. With ImmoScout24 we have been revolutionizing the real estate market in Germany and Austria for more than 25 years. Our goal is to build a digital ecosystem that brings homeowners, seekers, and agents together. Finding the right home and property is one of the most important decisions in life. So is your career! #WorkingatScout24 means being part of a diverse and inclusive team of 1,060 colleagues and 58 nationalities. We embrace difference and celebrate individuality. By encouraging open mindedness and authenticity we enable a true learning culture and prepare the ground for personal development. Mistakes are a chance to grow and to innovate. Together we act proactively, strive for improvement, and take responsibility. We talk about success and challenge while treating each other with respect because we are #oneteam.

If this sounds interesting to you, we would love to see you joining us! Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the job requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. Grow with us!. Welcome home!

 

Aside from our people and company culture we are offering awesome benefits that make Scout24 a great place to work!


Compensation: A competitive salary package and a bonus on top.
Flexibility: Decide for yourself where you work most effectively. We offer you a hybrid working model, autonomous working time management and 30 days of vacation annually.
Work from abroad: Our remote working policy includes the possibility to work from abroad for a few weeks per year (if it gets along with the business and team needs)
Relocation: Our relocation agency supports you with your visa process and an attractive relocation package.
Use our products: As an employee you can take advantage of our plus membership for tenants on ImmoScout24 to find a new place to live.
Development: Dedicated learning time per month, online courses on our ScoutAcademy, regular book challenges, structured feedback, "Lunch & Learn"-Events and individual career paths to push your career to the next level.   
Have kids? We'll support you with a professional family service, which helps you to find a childcare center or offers emergency childcare.  
Furry feel good manager: Bring your dog to work (upon approval, as we prioritise the well-being of our employees and ensure that our dog policy is considerate of allergic individuals and prevents overcrowding on each office floor).
Mobility: We subsidize public transport or Job Bikes.
Commitment to sustainability and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): We have clear environmental and climate protection goals and are involved in social activities and charitable organizations throughout the year. We live the diversity. Our theme weeks on diversity, mental well-being, and other social issues give us time and space to develop ourselves on DEI and sustainability.
Pension scheme: We offer a company pension scheme and support your own contribution with an attractive subsidy.
Most innovative office: Our office is barrier-free and in the heart of Berlin right at the central station. It was awarded for the most innovative office concept. We have an own gym with regular courses, napping room, rooftop terrace, organic coffee, cafeteria, 100% green electricity and a massage therapist that comes in once a week.
Health: Life Situation Coaching, regular health check ups
We are a tech company: We work with the latest technical tools and hardware. 


How your role will look like:


Serve as the subject matter expert on app analytics within a larger team of analysts, product managers, designers and software engineers
Collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
Build metrics around user journeys (e.g. customer lifetime value) and provide insights about cohorts like registered / non-registered users
Design data models, reports and visualizations by using technologies like Google Analytics/BigQuery, SQL and BI-Tools (e.g. MicroStrategy)
Contribute to a valuable, robust, and high-performing app analytics environment by optimizing code, debugging anomalies, and creating documentation
Provide training and support to team members on app analytics methodologies, tools, and best practices  


What you need to succeed:


Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analytics setting with mobile apps, preferably in a similar industry
Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus
Expertise in GA4 user tracking in apps, including dealing with technical challenges such as consent management or SDK issues
Strong proficiency in English language, German is a plus


We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.
Show more

  • Great understanding of eCommerce products and challenges
  • Expertise in GA4 user tracking is a must, ideally including how to deal with technical challenges such as tracking bugs or consent management
  • Experience with user journey concepts & metrics
  • Highly skilled in "working and telling with data" - statistical methods, data modelling, visualization and ability to turn complex topics into simple stories
  • Very good SQL skills are required. Additional languages and working with best-practice coding approaches (such as Git) are a plus
  • Expertise in GA4 user tracking in apps, including dealing with technical challenges such as consent management or SDK issues
  • Strong proficiency in English language, German is a plus

We aim to further enhance the diversity of our company and support the professional development of people with disabilities. We have a disability representative who will assist you throughout the application process. If you require this support, please let us know in advance.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond – while having fun with it.

We’re ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an innovative Data Analyst to help us understand the performance of our marketing activities and how to optimize them to improve our business. You will join the Business & Growth team, ensuring we make data-driven decisions that maximize ROI and drive business growth.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


Analyzing data for competitive advantages and flagging underperforming sources and tactics
Understanding what makes creative content successful
Supporting the marketing team in fully utilizing new attribution methods and models to determine the contribution of different activities
Ensuring quality and consistency of data, predictions, and targets
Building and maintaining reports and data models that assist in evaluating campaign and creative performance, allocating budgets, and setting targets



Requirements


A keen interest in staying up-to-date with the latest trends in the User Acquisition landscape
Knowledge of MMP, SKAN, and Google Privacy Sandbox
Extensive experience with data, either in gaming or digital marketing
Technical know-how in:
SQL at scale (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
Python, R, or Julia
Looker, Tableau, or equivalent visualization tool



In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have some of these as well:


Past work experience in F2P mobile gaming business
Familiarity with:
Data modeling and transformation with tools such as dbt
Version control using Git

Statistics or ML experience with skewed distributions, such as ROAS modeling


What We Offer


Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
Great opportunities to grow with the company
Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
Approachable leaders with low ego
Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office



Basics


Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
Work model: Mix of office and remote work
Working language: English



Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think “we” before “me”. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
Show more

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Show more
